SEARCH
Module io.fluxcapacitor.javaclient
Package io.fluxcapacitor.javaclient.common.serialization

Annotation Interface FilterContent

@Target({METHOD,ANNOTATION_TYPE}) @Retention(RUNTIME) public @interface FilterContent
Indicates that a method should be invoked to filter a value before it is exposed to a specific User.

This annotation is used in conjunction with ContentFilter.filterContent(Object, User) to dynamically determine whether and how an object (or part of it) should be visible to the given user.

The annotated method should return one of the following:

  • this – if the value is fully visible to the user
  • a modified copy – if only a subset of the value should be shown
  • null – if the value must be hidden entirely

Filtering is applied recursively to nested structures, including fields in collections and arrays.

Injection: The User instance will be automatically passed to the annotated method.

Example


 @FilterContent
 public Order filter(User user) {
     return user.hasRole("admin") ? this : new Order(maskedFieldsOnly());
 }
See Also:
  • ContentFilter.filterContent(Object, User)
